discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
e. The SSL mode of a cluster can only be set at the time of creation. The memberSslMode option is a string that configures the SSL mode to be used, it defaults to AUTO. The following modes are supported

choices.E: If only some InnoDB Cluster members are enabled for SSL group communication, and --ssl-mode=PREFERRED, communication will fall back to unencrypted connection.
choices.F: SSL group communication requires the use of an additional set of parameters group_replication_recovery_*.
choices.A: SSL group communication must be enabled at cluster creation time by specifying createCluster ({memberSslMode: 'REQUIRED'}).
choices.C: An existing InnoDB Cluster must be dissolved and created from scratch to enable SSL for group communication.
choices.D: SSL group communication can be enabled for an existing cluster, one instance at time, by setting group_replication_ssl_mode.
choices.B: Configuring SSL group communication also configures SSL distributed recovery.

questions.question_text:
All MySQL Server instances belonging to InnoDB Cluster have SSL configured and enabled.
You must configure InnoDB Cluster to use SSL for group communication.
Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

You are considering using file-system snapshots to back up MySQL.
Which three statements are true? (Choose three.)

choices.G: They do not use additional disk space.
choices.F: There is a slight performance cost while the snapshot is active.
choices.D: The backup window is almost zero from the perspective of the application.
choices.E: They do not back up views, stored procedures, or configuration files.
choices.C: They work best for transaction storage engines that can perform their own recovery when restored.
choices.A: They take roughly twice as long as logical backups.
choices.B: They allow direct copying of table rows with operating system copy commands.

discussion.content:
BDF

F because with the snapshot is has to keep backups of data that has changed. 
Thus, since it has to keep backups, it uses more diskspace, so not G.

comments.content:
B because you can copy the snapshot with os commands,. 
Not G, because as changes occur, it needs the save the OLD data, so it does require some diskspace as long as the snapshot is active,

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DFG
It's kind of full backup

questions.question_text:
Examine this snippet from the binary log file named binlog.000036:
//IMG//

The rental table was accidentally dropped, and you must recover the table.
You have restored the last backup, which corresponds to the start of the binlog.000036 binary log.
Which command will complete the recovery?

comments.content: sorry, A does not include the statement. Execution stops at that poisition, so anything after it won't execute. B is it, because its timestamp is AFTER that point.

questions.question_text:
Examine these entries from the general query log:
//IMG//

All UPDATE statements reference existing rows.
Which describes the outcome of the sequence of statements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C.

Selected Answer: C
root@localhost[world]> update t2 set val=42 where id =3805;
ERROR 1213 (40001): Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction

+--------------------------+-------+
| Variable_name | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| innodb_lock_wait_timeout | 900 |
+--------------------------+-------+

comments.content: I see I didn't say the answer. No commit is ever executed, so the transactions are in limbo. So E is the correct answer. Eventually a timeout will occur. Auto commit does not matter when you begin a transaction. Both connections hit the same row, and are not committed, so there are lock.

correction, 24 and 25 hit the same id, an started a transaction. B and C are correct except b is NOT correct if 24 commits before timeout. So C happens. And C happens because the updates happen BEFORE 24 commits.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Auto-commit not been disabled hence it should be able to execute all

choices.B: Connection 25 experiences a lock wait timeout.
choices.A: Connection 24 experiences a lock wait timeout.
choices.E: A deadlock occurs after innodb_lock_wait_timeout seconds.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
all databases with names that start with "db".
